title: 113_hr2452
content: The Act titled "Women's Procurement Program Equalization Act of 2013" aims to equalize the Women's Procurement Program. Section 8(m) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow for sole source contracts for economically disadvantaged women-owned small businesses. A contracting officer may award a sole source contract to a small business meeting specific requirements if there is no expectation of multiple offers, and the contract price does not exceed certain limits based on the type of contract opportunity. A contracting officer may award a sole source contract to a small business meeting specific requirements if there is no expectation of multiple offers and the contract price is fair and reasonable. The contracting officer may award a sole source contract to a small business if the contract price is fair and reasonable and does not exceed $6,500,000 for manufacturing contracts or $4,000,000 for other contracts. SEC. 3. REPORTING ON GOALS FOR PROCUREMENT CONTRACTS AWARDED TO SMALL BUSINESS CONCERNS. Section 15(h)(2)(E)(viii) of the Small Business Act is amended to include provisions for small business concerns owned and controlled by women, including through competitions and sole source contracts. Section 15(h)(2)(E)(viii) of the Small Business Act is amended to include provisions for small business concerns owned and controlled by women, including contracts awarded through sole source, industry waivers, and unrestricted competition.
